answers.author: Mark Abeles-Allison
answers.text:
Hi Jeff:  We instituted a new policy last year after a board member had an out of state assignment for work.  Committee members may  participate in meetings via phone, skype, or other types of electronic conferencing.   Highlights of the rules include  a stipulation that committee  members must be present for an entire agenda item in order to vote.  Members are not allowed to participate in executive sessions because of confidentiality concerns when someone is connecting remotely.  If you would like a copy of our policy let me know.  Mark

author: Jeffrey French
text:
County Board Supervisors are asking to attend Committee meetings remotely, via, skype, face-time, etc., and be paid their per-diem.  My questions are:
1.  Does your municipality allow this and what are the controls?
2.  If allowed, was the mechanism by ordinance or resoltuion or policy or past-practice?
3.  How did you answer the inevitable question then of allowing or not allowing employees to tele-commute?
4.  If allowed by your municipaltiy how's it working?  Pros/cons......
Thank you and my direct email address is jeff.french@co.barron.wi.us
title: Supervisors Attending Meetings Remotely
